Name: Goblin Tools
Summary: A collection of small, simple tools, for when things feel too big or complicated. 1) Magic To-do: Break down to-do items; 2) Formalizer: Text transformers for tone; 3) Judge: Read a text for emotion; 4) Professor: Explain anything; 5) Consultant: Help me decide; 6) Estimator: Guess an activity's timeframe for completion; 7) Compiler: Turn a brain-dump into actions; 8) Chef: Create a recipe from ingredients.

Name: Brain in Hand
Summary:
Brain in Hand is a hybrid support system for people with anxiety-based mental health 
challenges. It combines digital and human support to help people manage feelings of overwhelm, to find motivation to do things that matter to them, and to cope with everyday anxiety. With Brain in Hand, people have managed to become more independent, travel alone, deal with university life, and much more.
You decide how it can best support you in what you want to achieve.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes: Funding options: Through DSA/ Access to Work. Can also self-fund but expensive (£1000+)

Name: Finch
Summary:
Finch is a self-care pet app that helps you feel prepared and positive, one day at a time.
Take care of your pet by taking care of yourself!
Choose from a wide variety of self-care exercises personalized for you.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes: Free version with paid option for enhanced features

Name: Dragon Medical One
Summary:
A cloud-based speech recognition platform for healthcare professionals that converts their spoken words into text, improving documentation efficiency and freeing up time for patient care.
It features a medical-specific vocabulary, instant accuracy with no user training required, cloud hosting for accessibility across devices, and integration with electronic health records (EHRs).
The system uses artificial intelligence to capture clinical documentation quickly and accurately, acting as a companion to the clinician.

Name: Otter.AI
Summary:
A tool that uses artificial intelligence to transcribe speech to text, primarily for meetings and conversations.
It can record and transcribe audio in real-time, as well as transcribe pre-recorded audio and video files.
Otter.ai also offers features like meeting summaries, action item extraction, and collaboration tools

Name: Microsoft Dictate
Summary:
Dictation feature lets you use speech-to-text to author content in Office with a microphone and reliable internet connection.
Use your voice to quickly create documents, emails, notes, presentations, or even slide notes.
Further info / notes: Free with Microsoft 365 applications, but requires an active Microsoft 365 subscription

Name: Read&Write by Everway (previously 'TextHelp')
Summary:
Read&Write is an inclusion tool that supports neurodivergent employees, multi-lingual teams, and anyone who might find everyday literacy tasks a challenge.
It’s a powerful set of reading and writing tools that help anyone who struggles with digital text to excel in their work.

Name: ReachDeck
Coloured overlays plastic
Summary:
Coloured overlays, also known as tinted overlays, are thin sheets of coloured plastic that can be placed over text to help improve reading.
Its purpose is to act as a reading aid for those with visual stress and learning difficulties.
These coloured overlays come in a range of colours including purple, blue, yellow, pink, orange, green and grey.

Name: C-Pen Secure Reader 2
Summary: An assistive device for independent reading and understanding, especially designed to protect integrity in workplace use

Name: ReMarkable or E-ink tablets
Summary: E-ink tablets (also known as eNotes, eWriters and ePaper) are tablets that are designed to provide a comfortable reading and writing experience by using a screen technology (e-ink) that is much more akin to real paper (and easier on the eyes) than conventional LCD screens.
Further info / notes: For a guide to choosing e-writing tablets available: https://ewritable.net/

Name: LunaTask.app
Summary:
An all-in-one encrypted to-do list, habit tracker, journaling, life-tracking and notes app that remembers stuff for you 
and keeps track of your mental well-being
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Inspiration 11
Summary: Visual thinking tool to create concept maps, mind maps, diagrams, graphic organisers, outlines, and presentations

Name: Grammarly
Summary:
Grammarly is a digital writing assistant that uses AI to help users improve their written communication.
It checks for grammar, spelling, punctuation, clarity, and style, offering suggestions for improvement.
Grammarly works across various platforms, including websites and apps like Gmail, Google Docs, and Microsoft Word.
It also has generative AI features to help with brainstorming, researching, and outlining, as well as plagiarism detection

Name: Bionify
Summary: Read any public article faster with Bionify

Name: OpenDyslexic for Chrome
Summary:
OpenDyslexic is a free, open-source font designed to make reading easier for people with dyslexia.
This extension replaces all fonts on web pages with the OpenDyslexic font, making content more readable and accessible.

Name: Immersive Reader
Summary:
Immersive Reader is a free feature in various Microsoft 365 apps like Word, OneNote, Outlook, Teams, and Microsoft edge, designed to improve reading comprehension and accessibility for users of all ages and abilities.
It offers features such as text-to-speech, customization of text size, spacing, and background colors, syllable breakdown, and highlighting of different parts of speech.
It also includes a picture dictionary and translation capabilities.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: AHEAD app
Summary:
A personalized pocket coach that provides bite-sized, science-driven tools to boost emotional intelligence.
Start your personalized journey built by behaviour scientists, understand the why behind your emotions better, explore 100+ science proven techniques, and track and watch yourself progress every day.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes: Ahead offers a one-time 7-day free trial for new users to explore the app's features before committing to a subscriptio

Name: Calm app
Summary: Meditate daily with calm- whether you have 60 seconds or 60 minutes, Calm can help you build a habit of mindfulness
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes:
The free version offers limited access to content, the paid version 
offers more features such as guided meditations, music for focusing, relaxation and sleep, and calming nature sounds

Name: Headspace app
Summary: It provides mindfulness tools for everyday life, including meditations, sleepcasts, mindful movement and focus exercises.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes:
Subscription-based, but with a free trial.
You can unlock the entire Headspace library during your free trial.
During the trial, you will have access to all of our content, so you can explore and discover what works for you.
After the trial ends, you can sign up for a headspace subscription or you can cancel.

Name: Sweepy
Summary: An app that helps you keep your home clean and organized. Create your house cleaning schedule to split your chores with your family and turn your cleaning routine into a game.
Further info / notes: Free version with limited content for basic task tracking but requires a paid subscription for premium features like adding household members, automated task scheduling, and detailed performance insights

Name: Ayoa
Summary: Mind-mapping tool for creativity and productivity

Name: MindView AT
Summary: An assistive mind mapping software application that has been optimized for neurodiverse individuals and made truly accessible for users with disabilities

Name: Chef GPT - PantryChef
Summary: PantryChef- Add the ingredients you have at home, select what meal you want to cook, the kitchen utensils you have, how much time you have, your skill level, and it generates a recipe.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Loop earplugs
Summary:
Helps prevent sensory overload - Loop does not block sound, but 
filters it. Music and speech remain clear, just less loud
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Forest app
Summary:
It allows you to keep focus on a task when you are likely to be distracted by your phone.
This can help you with preventing procrastination on tasks and getting distracted.
The app allows you to set timers for how long you want to constantly work for e.g.
30 minutes and gives you a reasonable break to keep motivation high.
If you steer off task and get distracted by other apps, the tree which grows from completing the work time will die and you will have to start over, this is good motivation for people so they get rewarded by growing a forest the more they work.
Forest also works with trees for the future meaning that every time you fully grow a tree, one is planted in real life which means that while you are completing tasks, you are also helping the environment.

Name: Molehill mountain app
Summary: When you need to write down your worries and self-manage your day-to-day anxiety. The app uses research- based evidence to create exercises and practical tips to control anxiety throughout the day.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Routinery app
Summary:
A great app for those who struggle to make and keep daily routines.
The app is free and available on Apple and Android meaning that anyone who needs a boost with routines has access.
In the app, a ‘bot’ welcomes you and helps you create a morning routine with suggestions on what you may want to do e.g., making your bed, drinking water or showering.
When you complete a routine, you get a seed. In order to keep the seed alive, you must follow the routine you have set up, creating a motivation to want to complete the little tasks.
In the app, you can create as many ‘routines’ as you need to help you through the day with specific time frames from when you want to complete them

Name: Habitica app
Summary:
A routine help app which allows you to complete tasks with a reward.
Firstly, you select the areas you are trying to be more productive in, such as school and self-care.
You then set up tasks for yourself to complete in these areas and when you complete a task, such as finishing an essay, you get rewarded with points.
When you collect them, you get rewarded with things within the app, like virtual pets.
In Habitica, you can also join friends to take on quests or go solo and do monthly/ weekly challenges set by others.
The app is free and available on Apple, Android and online meaning that anyone can complete tasks from anywhere without needing to have a specific type of device.

Name: Tappy: Self-care fidgeter app
Summary:
A relaxation and mindfulness tool for iOS devices designed to help users reduce stress and anxiety through satisfying haptic feedback and sound effects.
The app includes various features such as interactive fidget games, guided meditations, soundscapes, breathing exercises, and mood and habit trackers.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Flora green focus app
Summary:
A way to stay off your phone, clear to-do lists, and build positive, life-changing habits.
Whenever you want to make progress toward your goals, grow trees in Flora!

Name: Me + Lifestyle Routine app
Summary:
It provides a daily routine planner and self-care schedule to establish a healthy habit and help with your daily routine.
By repeating good actions daily and following your planner and self-care schedule, you will gain a new outlook, confidence, and strength.
Obstacles that seemed unsurpassable will soon be overcome and forgotten
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: I am - Daily affirmations app
Summary: It is a daily affirmation and reminder app where you can choose and receive daily affirmations and is a simple way to build more positivity in your life.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: DailyBean- simplest journal app
Summary:
A simple app for recording your day with just a few taps, focusing on mood tracking and daily activities through a 
monthly calendar and colorful icons. Users select mood "beans" and activity icons to create a simple diary entry, add a picture, and a brief note.
The app also provides weekly and monthly statistics to analyze mood patterns and identify activities that influence feelings
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Medisafe Pill Reminder app
Summary: Pill reminder and medication tracker app
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Owaves: My BodyClock app
Summary:
Owaves is the first calendaring system designed to optimize your own personal circadian rhythm, also called the "body clock".
It is designed to let you prioritize vital, life-sustaining activities like exercise, nutrition, sleep, relaxation, and relationships, alongside work, school, productivity tasks and errands.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
Further info / notes: currently available for apple users only https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/owaves-my-bodyclock/id869648628

Name: Google Earth app
Summary: Can help individuals prepare by looking at new places in advance of visiting
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem

Name: Google Keep
Summary:
Quickly capture what's on your mind and get a reminder later at the right place or time.
Speak a voice memo on the go and have it automatically transcribed.
Grab a photo of a poster, receipt or document and easily organise or find it later in search.
Google Keep makes it easy to capture a thought or list for yourself and share it with friends and family.

Name: Access Able
Summary: Access Guides with accessible information for disabled people, carers, wheelchair users.
Areas of support: Self-regulation, Managing Emotions, Confidence, and Self-esteem
